KnowledgeBase.Title: isCharNumeric
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isChar isCharAlphanumeric isCharLowercase isCharName isCharAlphabetic isCharUppercase isCharWhitespace isString isText
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Character Alphabetic Object Uppercase Lowercase Name Underscore Numeric Alphanumeric Name Whitespace Boolean

Function.Description: The isCharNumeric function returns true if every character in the argument is numeric; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isCharNumeric function returns true if every character in the argument {obj} is a numeric character. Otherwise the isCharNumeric function returns false.
Brief.Usage: The isCharNumeric function function is used to query an object to see if it contains only numeric characters.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean

Syntax.Return: If the object contains only numeric characters, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned.
